file_insights.purpose: Custom React hook for detecting user preference for reduced motion
key_elements: Includes noSsr: true option for server-side rendering compatibility
file_insights.code_quality: High - comprehensive JSDoc documentation with example usage

patterns_discovered.description: Hook is specifically built to respect system accessibility preferences rather than ignoring them
Leveraging existing MUI utilities (useMediaQuery) rather than custom media query implementation
patterns_discovered.relevance: Reduces code duplication and maintains consistency with Material-UI patterns

patterns_discovered.description: Comprehensive JSDoc with parameter descriptions, return type, and practical usage example
patterns_discovered.relevance: Enables future developers to quickly understand and apply the hook correctly

patterns_discovered.description: noSsr: true configuration ensures the hook works correctly in server-side rendering contexts
patterns_discovered.relevance: Important for full-stack applications using Next.js or similar frameworks

gotchas_discovered.description: The hook may return false initially on SSR before hydration completes
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: The noSsr: true option helps mitigate this by avoiding SSR query execution

gotchas_discovered.description: Not all older browsers support the prefers-reduced-motion media query
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Hook gracefully returns false for unsupported browsers (safe default)

gotchas_discovered.description: Documentation shows when to animate but doesn't show concrete CSS-in-JS implementation
gotchas_discovered.impact: Developers still need to implement conditional animation logic themselves

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully created a reusable, well-documented accessibility hook that integrates with existing MUI infrastructure
key_achievements: Clean, simple API with single boolean return value
approach_outcome.completeness: Task fully completed in single successful attempt

recommendations.suggestion: Create companion hook usePrefersColorScheme for dark mode preference detection
recommendations.rationale: Follows similar accessibility pattern and would complete common preference detection needs

recommendations.suggestion: Add example demonstrating CSS-in-JS animation conditional logic with emotion or styled-components
recommendations.rationale: Would provide complete implementation guidance for developers integrating this hook

recommendations.suggestion: Create unit tests mocking different media query results to verify hook behavior
recommendations.rationale: Ensures hook works correctly across different user preference scenarios

recommendations.suggestion: Consider exporting the hook with React.memo if used in frequently re-rendering components
recommendations.rationale: Optimizes performance when hook is used in multiple components with short render cycles
